Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Wild Goat Style, pottery open vessel, possibly a thick bowl; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; possible traces of two added white bands; exterior: black band (fired reddish) between two lines.
Curator's comments: Chian bowls do not usually have a brown or black slip on their interior, however, given the sherd's form as an open vessel and its thickness, it has no parallels with any other shape. The lack of interior decoration suggests that it is an early vessel in the Chian series. For other similar sherds, see British Museum 1888,0601.468.d and 1888,0601.468.n.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2039) (phase 2)
